PetuniaT1.Text: Those blasted beavers happened that's what!" Petunia crossed her arms boldly. "Ever since they built that damn dam there has been very little water flowing down the river, I do not have enough to give to my flowers. I'm an old lady, I can't be going everyday uphill just for my plants.

PetuniaT2.Text: Not as long as those blasted beavers are around!" Petunia crossed her arms boldly. "Ever since they built that damn dam there has been very little water flowing down the river, I do not have enough to give to my flowers. I'm an old lady, I can't be going everyday uphill just for my plants.

PetuniaT3.Text: Excuse you?! You better watch your tone mister!" Petunia chastised. "It's not my fault those dumb beavers came!" Petunia crossed her arms boldly. "Ever since they built that damn dam there has been very little water flowing down the river, I do not have enough to give to my flowers. I'm an old lady, I can't be going everyday uphill just for my plants."

PetuniaT4.Text: Then be on your way!" Petunia scowled as she seemed ready to chase you out. Man this lady doesn't take rejection well.

PetuniaT5-PH.Text: Quest Accepted. Now, you need to go to the River Shore and destroy the beaver dam

DescriptionChanges.river-shore: Walking along the edge of the river you see a huge [Dam] limiting the waterflow. There doesn't seem to be anyone around except for the occasional beaver running past you.

PetuniaReward.Text:
Petunia beamed 'Wonderful! To be honest I'm not even sure why I asked, I can see the river flowing nicely. This will make my garden flourish once more!' she exclaimed.
Don't think I forgot about our deal, as promised I will dedicate this opportunity to make sure others have some food on their plate.'
She reassured you, well at least some good came out of this.
Though truthfully you'd rather forget what you had to do get here...

I guess there's nothing more to do here, right...

DescriptionChanges.petunias-garden: It seems like you're done here, you did all you could for the granny [Petunia]...

PetuniaAngry.Text: How dare you! Get out of here, I don't want to see your face again! Petunia scowled as she seemed ready to chase you out. Man this lady doesn't take rejection well...

PetuniaWaiting.Text: She sighed heavily 'Get back to me when it's over.'

DestroyDam.Text:
With unwavering determination you began swinging the bat over and over, cries of the wildlife filled your ears as the dam eventually gave out and water seeped through unobstructed.
   At least Petunia will be happy...

DescriptionChanges.river-shore: You see a beautiful flowing river...
DescriptionChanges.petunias-garden: [Petunia] is looking around with excitement... tell her...

LeaveDam.Text: What were you thinking? Only a monster could do something like this. Breathing a sigh of relief you began thinking about how you could explain this to Petunia later...

MerchantT1.Text:
Not another one...
the merchant sighs and forces a smile,
"Sorry but the manager isn't available at the moment, let me see what I can do for you..."

MerchantT2.Text: I understand... Anyways there's nothing I can do about the price so if there's nothing else I will have to ask you to leave." He exclaimed politely, you don't think there's anything else of note here.

MerchantT3.Text:
"Oh thank you! [Boss] is in the back, talk to him when you're ready!", he beamed.
Seems like you need to prepare for a negotiation.

MerchantT4.Text: 'Okay, talk to me when you're done' He returns to his duties.

BossT1.Text:
"How dare you?! Get out of here right this instance!"
Uh oh, he did not seem happy with that.'

BossT2.Text:
"And you're done, get out of my office before I call security."
Uh oh, seems like he didn't appreciate the outburst.

BossFail.Text:
'I said I would hear you out, I can see now that it was a mistake. Leave my office.' 
 Seems like that's it...

BossT3.Text:
"Pleasure doing business with you!"
You can't help but think about how much of a greedy bastard this guy is, but at least it's done with...

BossT4.Text:
Then I will have to ask you to leave, I am sorry that we could not come to an agreement.
You tried your best, nothing else you can do.

BossAllCorrect.Text:
'Alright, alright! I see your point, I will do what I can.'
Boss agreed to your proposal, you walk out of there with a rightfully deserved grin on your face.
You want to go back and talk to the [Merchant] again

BossEventComplete.Text:
'HE DID!', he merchant yelled in surprise.
That's fantastic news! Thank you so much!
Here have this, it's not a lot but I want to show you my thanks!

BernardCrowd.Text: Our 2 lumberjacks got injured. People try to help as they can but most just stand around and worry. I would love to get the issue resolved. For more details go ask them.

BernardT1.Text:
Well, I would appreciate my people getting back to work, go ask them what they need.
We would like to disassemble the ruins to the west and use the materials to build some shelters and a dam. However we lack the equipment, we have a great offer but we don't have any money left. If you would help us, we could give you some of our resources.

BernardT1-afterCrowd.Text:
Well, I would appreciate my people getting back to work, go ask them what they need.
We would like to disassemble the ruins to the west and use the materials to build some shelters and a dam. However we lack the equipment, we have a great offer but we don't have any money left. If you would help us, we could give you some of our resources.

BandagesE2.Text:
"Here you go!"
You've got the bandages, should you buy more?
Whatever you decide, you should not delay your return to the Village of Ix, injured men need your help!

DescriptionChanges.village-of-ix: The Village of Ix... Hmmm... now that you have the bandages, you should probably return to the injured men in the [Crowd]. Maybe after you give the bandages to the workers you could approach this mysterious man, [Captain Bernard].

BandagesS3.Text: Thank you, we can now proceed with our work!

DescriptionChanges.the-withering-forest-of-arberia: The forest, from your childhood, seemed to be nothing more than a distant memory, as you look around the narrow trees barely spanning for more than a few miles. Diving deeper you stumble upon a campfire surrounded by mournful lumberjacks.
DescriptionChanges.village-of-ix: The Village of Ix is a small village with most of the people living in wooden shelters or tents. There is a small house in the centre that serves as a town hall, standing in front is the [ Captain Bernard ].

BandagesE3.Text: Thank you, we have talked and agreed to bring the forest of arberia to its former glory. We will start planting new trees as soon as possible.

DescriptionChanges.the-withering-forest-of-arberia: Passing by the forest it almost feels brighter, as you see the lumberjacks from before as well as some of the other townsfolk working together to replant new life into this forest. You're certain that as the time goes it will become bigger and better then ever before!
DescriptionChanges.village-of-ix: The Village of Ix is a small village with most of the people living in wooden shelters or tents. There is a small house in the centre that serves as a town hall, standing in front is the [ Captain Bernard ].
DescriptionChanges.crossroads-of-cordon:
Just dusty roads...
A lot of people pass through here...

GalavaFinish.Text: Thank you, we will start working as soon as possible. Come check our work in Galava when you'll have time!

DescriptionChanges.galava-castle-ruins: With many hands on deck you watch as the crew set out their work and carefully disassemble the historical ruin. While the locals might not be pleased, you remind yourself that in tough times hard choices sometimes are necessary for the greater good.

MineQuizFinish.Text:
The display flashes and proceeds to boot to what looks like main menu.
Miner: "Thank you! Here is part of money we were given to fix this. (+30 Gold)"

DescriptionChanges.abandoned-mine: Damp corridors lit up by torches, stretching deep down into the mines, are filled with sounds of pickaxes hitting hard rocks. Miners greet you with grateful smiles for the help you have provided, you can't help but feel a little proud of yourself.

YouReturned.Text: "Nice to see you here again, fella, do you remember what I was talking about with you before, maybe you changed your mind..."

ThankYou.Text: "Very well, then! Now we'll have a speed travel point to the Dues of Raghar to the island's east"

DescriptionChanges.distant-island:
Interesting, a bunch of wood shreads laying around, some household items on the ground...
...seems like a lot of people have passed through there while moving away from the island...

Interesting, a bunch of wood shreads laying around, some household items on the ground...
...seems like a lot of people have passed through there while moving away from the island...
Woodworking has stopped here, at least it will be peaceful here for a while...

Though this island can only be entered from one side of the mainland, people here how have sturdy homes...
it's nice to see smiling faces from afar...

LeaveFight.Text: She looks abit annoyed. But better annoyed than angry. I am not ready for this... yet.

PetuniaLost.Text: Petunia laughs: "You couldnt't have possible thought you could defeat me, right? I will give you one more chance to leave." Damn, this lady is scary, better get away before she changes her mind.
